description: Though vessels like this were designed to hold water for ritual bathing before marriage, they could also be placed at the tombs of young women who did not live to a marriageable age. This example likely served such a purpose, as it depicts a woman within a naiskos, a temple-like structure marking a family gravesite, in addition to images of a bride preparing herself for her wedding day with the help of female friends and family.
artist_info:
Attributed to the Varrese Painter
Greek; Apulia
Italy
title: Loutrophoros (Container for Bath Water)
